paper_abstract: For Martin-Lof type theory with a hierarchy U-0 : U-1 : U-2 :... of univalent universes, we show that U-n is not an n-type. Our construction also solves the problem of finding a type that strictly has some high truncation level without using higher inductive types. In particular, U-n is such a type if we restrict it to n-types. We have fully formalized and verified our results within the dependently typed language and proof assistant Agda.
paper_title: Higher Homotopies in a Hierarchy of Univalent Universes
